page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: The largest house in our block is the Down House, a large mansion, but it is not open to the public. The smallest houses are one bedroomed flats built by the Council in 1980. The Council also built flats for elderly people at Johnstone Close. There are 24 flats and a warden who looks after the residents. There were originally 80 Chartist bungalows built in 1848 for working people. Only 60 are left now. Since 1945 many new houses have been built including a private estate of 40 houses, built 10 years ago, called Compton Close. The Council also built many other but most are privately owned now. One of the oldest houses is called Staunton Court. It was owned by Dick Whittington's brother and was built in the 14th century.
